#summary linkTo([text,confirm,route,controller,action,key,params,anchor,onlyPath,host,protocol,port])
#labels api,0.9

*Category*:

[ViewHelperFunctions View Helper Functions]

*Description*:

Creates a link to another page in your application. Pass in a route name to use your configured routes or a controller/action/key combination.

*Return Type*:

String

*History*:

-

*Parameters*:

||   || *Type* || *Required* || *Default* || *Description* ||
|| *text* || string || false ||   || The text content of the link ||
|| *confirm* || string || false ||   || Pass a message here to cause a JavaScript confirmation dialog box to pop up containing the message ||
|| *route* || string || false ||   || See documentation for `URLFor` ||
|| *controller* || string || false ||   || See documentation for `URLFor` ||
|| *action* || string || false ||   || See documentation for `URLFor` ||
|| *key* || string, list or number || false ||   || See documentation for `URLFor` ||
|| *params* || string || false ||   || See documentation for `URLFor` ||
|| *anchor* || string || false ||   || See documentation for `URLFor` ||
|| *onlyPath* || boolean || false || true || See documentation for `URLFor` ||
|| *host* || string || false ||   || See documentation for `URLFor` ||
|| *protocol* || string || false ||   || See documentation for `URLFor` ||
|| *port* || number || false ||   || See documentation for `URLFor` ||

*Examples*:

{{{
#linkTo(text="Log Out", controller="account", action="logOut")#
-> <a href="/account/logout">Log Out</a>
}}}

{{{
#linkTo(text="Log Out", action="logOut")#
-> <a href="/account/logout">Log Out</a> (if you're already in the "account" controller Wheels will assume that's where you want the link to go.)
}}}

{{{
#linkTo(text="View Post", controller="blog" action="post", key=99)#
-> <a href="/blog/post/99">View Post</a>
}}}

{{{
#linkTo(text="View Settings", action="settings", params="show=all&sort=asc")#
-> <a href="/account/settings?show=all&amp;sort=asc">View Settings</a>
}}}

{{{
#linkTo(text="Joe's Profile", route="userProfile", userName="joe")#
-> <a href="/user/joe">Joe's Profile</a> (given that a "userProfile" route has been configured in "config/routes.cfm".)
}}}
